2:
"How you have helped one who has no power!\q How you have saved the arm that has no strength!
\q
3:
How you have advised one who has no wisdom\q and announced to him sound knowledge!
\q
4:
With whose help have you spoken these words?\q Whose spirit was it that came out from you?


\q
5:
The dead are made to tremble,\q those who are beneath the waters
\q and all who dwell in them.
\q
6:
Sheol is naked before God;\q destruction itself has no covering against him.


\q
7:
He stretches out the northern skies \q over the empty space,
\q and he hangs the earth over nothing.
\q
8:
He binds up the waters in his thick clouds,\q but the clouds are not torn under them.


\q
9:
He covers the surface of the moon\q and spreads his clouds on it.
\q
10:
He has engraved a circular boundary on the surface of the waters\q as the line between light and darkness.


\q
11:
The pillars of heaven tremble\q and are astonished at his rebuke.
\q
12:
He calmed the sea with his power;\q by his understanding he shattered Rahab.


\q
13:
By his breath he made the skies clear; \q his hand pierced the fleeing serpent.
\q
14:
See, these are but the fringes of his ways;\q how small a whisper do we hear of him!
\q Who can understand the thunder of his power?"
